meanings.definition: The quality or state of being evasive or shifty.
meanings.sent1: His dodginesses in answering the questions made everyone suspicious.
meanings.sent2: The detective sensed some dodginesses in the suspect's story.
meanings.sent3: The dodginesses of the squirrel trying to avoid the cat were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her dodginesses were like a shadow, always present but never fully seen.
meanings.sent5: The dodginesses of the fog made it hard to see beyond a few feet.

meanings.sent1: The dodginesses of his actions raised red flags for the authorities.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore the dodginesses of the situation any longer.
meanings.sent3: The dodginesses of the cat pretending to be innocent were quite funny.
meanings.sent4: The dodginesses of the storm clouds hinted at trouble ahead.
meanings.sent5: His dodginesses at the poker table gave away his bluff.

meanings.sent1: The dodginesses of the used car salesman made customers wary.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of dodginesses surrounding the online reviews.
meanings.sent3: The dodginesses of the broken compass led them in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her promises had a hint of dodginesses that made others doubt her.
meanings.sent5: The dodginesses of the old bridge made crossing it a risky endeavor.
